title: Towards Lightweight, Adaptive and Attribute-Aware Multi-Aspect Controllable Text Generation with Large Language Models
author: Chenyu Zhu (Alibaba International Digital Commerce), Yefeng Liu (Alibaba International Digital Commerce), Chenyang Lyu (Alibaba International Digital Commerce), Xue Yang (Alibaba International Digital Commerce), Guanhua Chen (Southern University of Science and Technology), Longyue Wang (Alibaba International Digital Commerce), Weihua Luo (Alibaba International Digital Commerce), Kaifu Zhang (Alibaba International Digital Commerce)
relevance_why: The framework for multi-aspect controllable text generation could be adapted for audio and speech tasks, such as generating conversational audio that adheres to specified attributes allowing for nuanced content delivery.
background: Developing a method for generating text that adheres to multiple specific attributes, enhancing text generation flexibility for applications like personalized content creation.
contribution: This paper introduces a lightweight and adaptive framework that integrates multiple Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) modules for improved controllability of text attributes, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like Full Fine-Tuning (FFT) demand extensive resources and are prone to overfitting, while LoRA allows efficient fine-tuning but lacks competitiveness.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines multiple LoRA modules and introduces a gating function, dynamically adjusting control strength across attributes to improve adaptability and robustness.

key_innovation: Utilizes an innovative combination of multiple LoRA modules and a dynamic gating mechanism to enhance control over text attribute generation efficiently.
real_world_impact: The advancements in controllable text generation can significantly enhance applications in automated content creation and conversational agents, allowing for more personalized and contextually appropriate responses.
limitations: Limitations include reliance on fixed attribute sets and challenges in high-conflict attribute scenarios where contradictions arise.

new_terms.Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA): **Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA)** is a method for fine-tuning large models by training a small number of parameters while keeping the rest fixed, aimed at reducing computational complexity.
